Node.definition: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: satiated (with an event); hence: = process by which humans become more than fully engaged in a certain process or activity, which can be either good or bad
= state in which the body of humans and animals shakes involuntarily, ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, excitement, or other emotions
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit
literally: to come out; = process by which land or a living organism produces crops, branches, horns, or fruits
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
literally: to open (one's) eyes; hence: = action by which deities make an active effort to see something

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans or deities are free from moral contamination
= state in which humans have been morally and/or ethically contaminated by evil behavior
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to cut a decision; hence: = action by which humans or deities come to a formal and authoritative decision about something
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= point in time set for a particular purpose
= causative action by which deities or humans in a position of authority establish a certain condition or pattern of events
= causative action by which deities or humans stop performing an ongoing event
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

= a person who has made himself available to be of service to others for a limited amount of time and in return for payment; who is usually paid daily, and his fragile rights are protected by the law; ≈ often used in metaphors expressing short and limited periods of time

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object
= process by which an object appears in a certain location
= process by which objects stop existing in this world
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

= the main body of a tree, which is either the part that remains in the earth after the stem or trunk is cut off, or a branch that is planted with the intention that it develops new roots; ≈ symbol of something apparently dead that has the potential for renewed life

Node.gloss: scent of water > presence of water
Node.definition: literally: scent of water; hence: = state in which water is nearby

Node.gloss: to bear|to yield|to produce|to bring forth
Node.definition: literally: to make; hence: = natural process by which land, plants, or animals develop vegetation, branches, fruits, produce milk, etc.
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= process by which humans run out of physical strength

Node.gloss: to expire|to breathe one's last|to perish
Node.definition: = process by which a human being breathes his last breath, ◄ either as a result of a natural cause or of an unnatural cause, ► resulting in death
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= to gradually disappear from a certain location
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= flowing body of water

= process by which a body of water or place that was formerly covered with moisture dries up, ◄ as a result of evaporation or draining; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

see יקץ (יקץ)|= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= causative action by which humans bring other humans to a particular location ► in order to keep them from danger
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: to turn away|to come to an end|to cease|to subside
Node.definition: literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to set an allotment; hence: = action by which deities determine a certain moment in the future for an event to take place
= point in time set for a particular purpose

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to be alive|to become alive|to live
Node.definition: = to be alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= individual or group of people that is to replace another individual or group of people and take over his/her/their duty
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to desire|to long for|to be eager
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans, deities, or animals experience a strong desire to see an object or perform an event
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to count (someone's) steps; hence: = action by which deities keep track of everything someone does
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

Node.gloss: to seal (someone's) sins in a bag > to forgive (someone's sins)
Node.definition: literally: to seal up (someone's) sins in a bag; hence: = causative action by which a deity forgives a wrongful act, ◄ as if by putting it in a sealed bag and so removing it from reality
= small container ◄ made of cloth; ► used to transport money, pack aromatic spices in order to put it between clothes, etc .; ≈ associated with possessions and treasures
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= action by which someone's evil deeds are covered, which means that they are forgiven
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which a structure loses its inner strength and falls apart
= process by which objects slowly break or fall apart into small pieces
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
= process by which rocks move spontaneously from one place to another

= an object ◄ of stone, ► usually found in nature and used for throwing, building crude constructions; stones with a particular shape are sometimes used as a memorial or religious symbol; ≈ regarded as extremely common, easily available, but also as strong, hard, and unflexible
= a strong and fast flowing stream of water
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

Node.gloss: to destroy|to corrupt|to put an end
Node.definition: = action by which someone brings an event to an end, usually under unfavorable circumstances
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only

Node.gloss: to send away|to divorce|to expel|to remove|to cast out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons

Node.gloss: to be honorable|to be worthy of honor|to be renowned
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are regarded as worthy of honor and respect
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
= state in which humans are physically wounded

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances
